p: Compounds 222– 223 were evaluated for in vitro inhibition of cell proliferation by the MTT method using a panel of four human cancer cell lines: NCI-H460 (non-small cell lung cancer), SF-268 (CNS glioma), MCF-7 (breast cancer), and PC-3 (prostate adenocarcinoma) cells. Compounds 222 and 223 showed moderate cytotoxicity against four human cancer cell lines with IC 50 values of 18.63 ± 1.82, 20.23 ± 2.15, 23.53 ± 2.33 and 20.48 ± 2.04 µM, and 16.47 ± 1.63, 17.57 ± 2.12 20.79 ± 2.39 and 19.43 ± 2.02 µM, respectively, while compound D ( Figure 13) was found to be inactive (>50 µM), which suggested -NH 2 group might play a very important role for their cytotoxicity. Doxorubicin (Adriamycin) was used as positive control in this assay (IC 50 values against the 4 human cancer cell lines: 0.43 ± 0.12 µM, 0.61 ± 0.09 µM, 0.41 ± 0.11 µM and 0.25 ± 0.08 µM respectively) [ 72].
